Class ObjectMotion

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
ObjectMotion
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ObjectMotion extends Thread
Controls motion for a score puck or magnet, also notifies GameController thread if a player has scored.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • roundOver

      public Boolean roundOver()
      Returns:
      A boolean value that indicates whether the round is over.

    • run

      public void run()
      Activates the motion of the score puck and the magnets depending on the piece index
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • enteredGoal

      public Boolean enteredGoal(int goalType)
      If the puck reaches either goal, the round is terminated
      Parameters:
      goalType - 1 for the left goal, 2 for the right goal
      Returns:
      The distance between the puck and the goal.

    • playerInteract

      public void playerInteract(Ball object, Ball player)
      If the player collides with the ball, deflect the ball and move the player in the direction of the ball's deflection
      Parameters:
      object - The object that is being interacted with.
      player - The player object

    • magnetsInteract

      public void magnetsInteract(Ball object)
      If the ball collides with a magnet, deflect the ball and move the magnet
      Parameters:
      object - the ball that is being deflected

    • displacementCheck

      public Boolean displacementCheck(Ball magnet, double deflectX, double deflectY, double radius)
      If a ball is going to be displaced outside the bounds of the screen, return false
      Parameters:
      magnet - the ball that is being checked
      deflectX - the x coordinate of the ball if deflection occurs
      deflectY - the y-coordinate of the ball if deflection occurs
      radius - the radius of the ball
      Returns:
      If the ball is safe to deflect

    • moveObject

      public void moveObject(Ball object, double xPosition, double yPosition, double radius, double frictionLoss)
      If the object is going to hit a wall, this method deflects the object and absorbs a portion of the objects momentum The first thing the function does is calculate the position the object will be in if it continues on its current trajectory. If the object is going to hit a wall, the function reverses the object's velocity and slows it down. Friction force is also applied to slow it down
      Parameters:
      object - The object that is being deflected
      xPosition - the x-coordinate of the object
      yPosition - the y-coordinate of the object
      radius - the radius of the object
      frictionLoss - velocity percetage conserved while moving

    • attractionControl

      public void attractionControl(Ball magnet, Ball player1, Ball player2, double attractionForce)
      If the distance between the magnet and either player is less than 13.5, the magnet latches on to the player. If the distance is less than attractBound, the magnet is attracted to the player, attract force based on proximity
      Parameters:
      magnet - The magnet object in focus
      player1 - The first player object
      player2 - The second player object
      attractionForce - The velocity that a magnet heads towards the player

    • attract

      public void attract(Ball magnet, double magnetXPos, double magnetYPos, double playerXPos, double playerYPos, double attractionForce)
      Attracts the magnet in a direction depending on its position relative to the player
      Parameters:
      magnet - The magnet object that is being attracted to the player
      magnetXPos - The x position of the magnet
      magnetYPos - The y position of the magnet
      playerXPos - The x position of the player
      playerYPos - The y position of the player
      attractionForce - The force of attraction.

    • playerLatch

      public void playerLatch(Ball player)
      While the thread is not interrupted, set the magnet's x and y position to the player's x and y position. This is called when a magnet is confirmed to be latched
      Parameters:
      player - The player object that the magnet will latch onto.

    • deflect

      public void deflect(Ball object1, Ball object2)
